definitions.definition: the direction that goes towards the part of the earth below the equator, opposite to the north, or the part of an area or country that is in this direction:
examples: The points of the compass are north, south, east, and west.

definitions.definition: the southern states of the US:
examples: The American Civil War was fought between the North and the South partly over the issue of slavery.

definitions.definition: the developing countries of the world, most of which are below the equator
in or forming the south part of something:
a wind coming from the south
to or in the south of a country or region:
examples: Alice got a job down south.

definitions.definition: (in or to) England, when considered in relation to Scotland
(in or to) Mexico and the other countries south of the US border with Mexico, when considered in relation to the US
